description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ddf","text":"Here we describe a protocol for measuring chlorophyll-a and pheophytin-a from microalgae by using Turner Designs (10-AU)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7kc5c","text":"The entire procedure should be carried out as much as possible in subdued light (Green) to prevent photodecomposition.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8mdbk","text":"All glassware should be clean and acid free to prevent  chlorophyll-a degradation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61e8u","text":"Waste disposal:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d3d6d","text":"        Follow all laboratory waste disposal guidelines regarding the disposal of acetone, DMSO solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: Improved extraction of chl and b from algae using dimethyl sulfoxide

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"80q8f","text":"Primary stock: ≅10 mg/L","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5s8pu","text":"Saturated magnesium carbonate solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2f3ig","text":"Extract samples on the filter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fm1j4","text":"Allow Turner to warm-up for at least 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aj8l","text":"90% buffered acetone","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fmq1h","text":"Acetone/DMSO extraction solvent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8camd","text":"0.1 N HCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2h9l0","text":"Use extraction of blank filter to zero the instrument on the sensitivity setting that will be used for sample analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1m06","text":"Or simply log the reading of blank filter extraction and subtract the reading from reading of sample extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9jeg","text":"Vortex and place sample in the dark for another   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8vqs1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"86D77230250611EBB4FF5514E62FBDD6","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"i6ak","text":"Come as a set of one low (15 ~ 20 ug/L) and one high (140 ~ 160 ug/L) concentration in foil wrapped ampules. Use low concentration for the calibration only.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"asr1s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"btgea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"du94j","text":"Actual concentration varies by LOT, and is listed on a certificate","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32cim","text":"Break the ampule with breaker and pour directly into the test tube ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7b75a","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1amtn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97blu","text":"Press \u003c1\u003e to access screen 2.1 and confirm that option #2 on screen 2.1 reads YES. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dot5i","text":"Press \u003cEsc\u003e to return to HOME screen. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rh48","text":"While on the HOME screen, fill a clean 13-mm culture tube with 90% acetone (the blank). Put the tube in the sample chamber and replace the light cap. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7dpv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"32kk8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"31j5","text":"Because temperature affects fluorescence, do not allow the blank to remain in the instrument any longer than necessary for a stable reading.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d43lb","text":"Press \u003cENT\u003e , \u003c2\u003e, \u003c1\u003e, and \u003c1\u003e to access 2.11 After the Blank % reading is stable (“TC” on screen 2.11 cycles from 1 to 8 seconds) and assuming the Blank % is less than 200%, press \u003c0\u003e. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5j3l6","text":"When “FINISHED” appears, press \u003cESC\u003e all the way to HOME. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8qblm","text":"Remove the blank. Set tube aside.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vliu","text":"While on the HOME screen, place the tube with the LOW primary chlorophyll a standard in the sample chamber and replace the light cap. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5numg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ccaes","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"31j5","text":"Because temperature affects fluorescence, do not allow the blank to remain in the instrument any longer than necessary for a stable reading.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1spv","text":"Pressing \u003cENT\u003e, \u003c2\u003e, and \u003c3\u003e to access 2.3","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"q5ga","text":"Using UP and DOWN arrows to adjust Span% until the FS reading is the closest to actual value of primary standard. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d18m9","text":"Wait until reading is stable (“TC” on screen cycles from 1 to 8 sec.), then press \u003c*\u003e. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"au1ls","text":"When “FINISHED” appears, press \u003cESC\u003e all the way to HOME screen. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4s9g4","text":"Read the primary liquid standard on the home screen by pressing \u003c*\u003e, to confirm that the calibration was properly set and record the calibrant and reading on the calibration log sheet. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aenv9","text":"Use polypropylene pipet tip to transfer 5 mL 90% acetone to disposable glass tube, wipe the outside of the tube dry with kimwipe and place in the instrument. {"blocks":[{"key":"f13r3","text":"Wait about 15 seconds for the reading to stabilize, and zero the instrument on the sensitivity setting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6j974","text":"Transfer 5 mL working calibration standard (prepared in   ) to a disposable glass tube, measure the fluorescence. Log the reading as \"standard before acidification (Rb)\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":166,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"51q59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5D8BF160251711EBB4FF5514E62FBDD6","id":0,"step_guid":"C588515012E811EBB4B9D3C9217AA87C","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"foeek","text":"Carefully mix solution by vortexing for 10 seconds and measure the fluorescence again. {"blocks":[{"key":"b5lt1","text":"Calculate the ratio, r, as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cedf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"","data":{"formula":"r=Rb/Ra=7.66/3.70=2.07","guid":"4AAF7E30251811EBB4FF5514E62FBDD6","id":0}}}}
